result.execSummary:
The defendant Antonio P Anderson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Door County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes: Pay costs of the action. Pay supervision fees as ordered by Dept. of Corrections. If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with Count 1 and case no. 14-CF-70.

miscConds.notes: Pay $100 fine plus costs. Pay supervision fees as ordered by Dept. of Corrections. If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

Not to possess or consume any controlled substances without a valid prescription and then only take in the amount and frequency prescribed. Not to possess or use any drug paraphernalia. No contact direct or indirect with victims without consent of victim and Dept. of Corrections.
Complete any counseling, evaluations, programs and assessments as appropriate resulting from the Department's COMPAS assessment.
Obtain AODA assessment and comply with treatment recommendations.

timeConds.notes: Stayed, to be used at discretion of Court through Petition of Dept. of Corrections. Huber privileges granted if stay is lifted.

Defendant Antonio P Anderson in court with attorney Gregory A. Gerbers. Defendant Antonio P Anderson in custody. Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews max. penalties, elements, setting of case for prelim. State advises of plea agreement, moves to amend Count 3 to misdemeanor. Defendant enters no contest pleas to Counts 1, 3. Court questions Defendant on rights, finds pleas made freely and voluntarily, accepts pleas, and finds Defendant guilty of Counts 1, 3. Counts 2, 4 are dismissed but read in for sentencing. State/Defense make joint sentencing recommendations. Bond no longer in effect.
Additional Request for Electronic Discovery for Door County Cases
by Defendant

Defense presents argument for reduced bond. Court advises of difficulty of Atty Maciolek to reach Defendant. Defense/Defendant advises of employment, residence. Court will not amend bond at this time.
Preliminary hearing on July 23, 2014 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Antonio P Anderson in court with attorney Eric R. Heywood.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Copy of Complaint given to Defendant in Court. Court reviews charges, max. penalties, right to counsel, right to prelim.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 23, 2014 at 09:00 am.
Defendant was fingerprinted on 7/5/14.
No contact direct or indirect with JG, CM and 1549 N. 14th Ave, Upper.

Defendant Antonio P Anderson appeared by video conference. Attorney Darrin S. Crawford appeared by phone. Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State gives incident report, potential charges. Court questions Defendant on address/employment history, reviews right to Counsel. Court finds probable cause, sets bond. Return 7/14/14, 10:00.
